text:
Exploratory Analyses: Methodology
Data was collapsed such that each student has a total summary count of:

Emails sent by their advisor
Emails replied to by the student - phone calls made to the student by their advisor
Duration of the phone calls
A variable, gpa_diff was calculated that subtracts the student’s semester end GPA from the GPA they started with. If the values are greater than 0, the student improved. If the value is less than 0, the student did not improve.

In all instance (save for freshman data) the time-frame was between January and May.

Exploratory Analyses: Questions
Does increased communication with students (intrusive advisement) result in overall greater GPA?
Total Number of Emails Sent and GPA Difference

Codecor.test(aw_sum$total_em_sent,aw_sum$gpa_diff) |> 
  hux_corr() |> 
  set_caption("Table 1: Pearson correlation shows that there is no significant relationship between overall emails sent and difference in GPA from start to end of semester") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)


Table 1: Pearson correlation shows that there is no significant relationship between overall emails sent and difference in GPA from start to end of semester


r
t
df
p
CI[LL,UU]
alternative


0.121
1.38
127
0.171
[-0.05,0.29]
two.sided






Codeaw_sum |> 
  ggplot(aes(total_em_sent,gpa_sem)) + 
  geom_jitter(aes(color = gpa_color)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0,
             linetype = 2,
             color = "darkred") +
  labs(
    x = "\nTotal Number of Emails Sent (Jan-May)",
    y = "Difference in GPA from Fall 2021\n"
  ) +
  scale_color_identity()







Total number of emails replied to and GPA Difference

Codecor.test(aw_sum$total_em_reply,aw_sum$gpa_diff) |> 
  hux_corr() |> 
  set_caption("Table 2: Pearson correlation shows that there is no significant relationship between overall emails replied to and difference in GPA from start to end of semester") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)


Table 2: Pearson correlation shows that there is no significant relationship between overall emails replied to and difference in GPA from start to end of semester


r
t
df
p
CI[LL,UU]
alternative


0.0782
0.884
127
0.379
[-0.1,0.25]
two.sided






Code# Plot the relationship
aw_sum |> 
  ggplot(aes(total_em_reply,gpa_diff)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = gpa_color)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0,
             linetype = 2,
             color = "darkred")+
  labs(
    x = "\nTotal Number of Emails Replied To (Jan-May)",
    y = "Difference in GPA from Fall 2021\n"
  ) +
  scale_color_identity()







Total Phone Call Duration and GPA Difference

Code# r(127), r = .22, p = .012*
cor.test(aw_sum$total_phone_duration, aw_sum$gpa_diff) |> 
  hux_corr()|> 
  set_caption("Table 3: Pearson correlation shows that there is a significant positive relationship between overall phone call duration and difference in GPA from start to end of semester") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)


Table 3: Pearson correlation shows that there is a significant positive relationship between overall phone call duration and difference in GPA from start to end of semester


r
t
df
p
CI[LL,UU]
alternative


0.22
2.54
127
0.0122
[0.05,0.38]
two.sided






Code# Plot the relationship
aw_sum |> 
  ggplot(aes(total_phone_duration,gpa_diff)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0,
             linetype = 2,
             color = "darkred") +
  geom_point(aes(color = gpa_color)) +
  labs(
    x = "\nPhone Call Duration (Minutes) (Jan-May)",
    y = "Difference in GPA from Fall 2021\n",
    caption = "r(127), .22, p = .012"
  ) +
  scale_color_identity()







Regressions
To see whether the contact methods would serve as predictors, the variable gpa_diff was used as the outcome variable and mode of communication (email, phone call) served as the predictor variable.

Codemod1 <- lm(data = aw_sum, gpa_diff ~ total_phone_duration) |> summary()
mod2 <- lm(data = aw_sum, gpa_diff ~ total_em_sent) |> summary()
mod3 <- lm(data = aw_sum, gpa_diff ~ total_em_reply) |> summary()

huxreg(
  Model_1 = mod1, 
  Model_2 = mod2,
  Model_3 = mod3,
  error_pos = "right",
  bold_signif = .05
) |> 
  set_caption("Table 4: Regression table showing phone call duration as a predictor of GPA improvement") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)

Warning in huxreg(Model_1 = mod1, Model_2 = mod2, Model_3 = mod3, error_pos = "right", : Unrecognized statistics: logLik, AIC
Try setting `statistics` explicitly in the call to `huxreg()`

Exploratory Analyses: Questions

Does intrusive advising correlate with GPA at the end of the semester?

Exploratory Analyses: Methodology
Data was collapsed such that each student has a total summary count of:

Emails sent by their advisor
Emails replied to by the student
No phone call data was collected or analyzed for Freshmen data.


Code# Summary Counts for Emails sent and Replied
# Exclude Phone Calls
fsh_sum <- 
  fsh |> 
  mutate_at(vars(gpa_fall_2022),as.numeric) |>
  mutate(
    gpa_color = ifelse(gpa_fall_2022 > 0,"#006F71","#dfc26e"),
    academic_standing_december_2022 = case_when(
        academic_standing_december_2022 == "AW" ~ "Academic Warning",
        academic_standing_december_2022 == "Withdrew" ~ "Withdrew",
        academic_standing_december_2022 == "PR" ~ "Academic Probation",
        academic_standing_december_2022 == "Semster withdrawal" ~ "Semester Withdrawal",
        is.na(academic_standing_december_2022) ~ "Good Standing"
      )
    ) |> 
  # Group by rows
  rowwise() |> 
  # Create Summary Counts for Emails Sent/Received and Phone Calls Made/Duration
  mutate(
    total_em_sent = sum(c_across(c(sep_em_sent, oct_em_sent, nov_em_sent, dec_em_sent)), na.rm = T),
    total_em_reply = sum(c_across(c(sep_em_re,oct_em_re, nov_em_re, dec_em_re)),na.rm = T)
  ) 



Codefsh_sum |> 
  select(academic_standing_december_2022) |> 
  rename(
    `Academic Standing` = academic_standing_december_2022
  ) |> 
  tabyl(`Academic Standing`) |>
  adorn_pct_formatting() |> 
  rename(
    Frequency = n, 
    `%` = percent
  ) |> 
  hux() |> 
  theme_article() |> 
  set_caption("Frequency Table of End of Semester Allocation for Freshmen Students")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)


Frequency Table of End of Semester Allocation for Freshmen Students


Academic Standing
Frequency
%


Academic Probation
2
1.7%


Academic Warning
33
27.7%


Good Standing
78
65.5%


Semester Withdrawal
1
0.8%


Withdrew
5
4.2%





Total Emails Sent and End of Semester GPA

Codecor.test(fsh_sum$total_em_sent,fsh_sum$gpa_fall_2022) |> 
  hux_corr() |>
  set_caption("Table 9: A pearson correlation shows a significant positive relationship between overall emails sent to student and GPA at the end of the semester") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)


Table 9: A pearson correlation shows a significant positive relationship between overall emails sent to student and GPA at the end of the semester


r
t
df
p
CI[LL,UU]
alternative


0.185
1.98
111
0.0499
[0,0.36]
two.sided






Codefsh_sum |> 
  ggplot(aes(total_em_sent, gpa_fall_2022)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0,
             linetype = 2, 
             color = "darkred") +
  geom_point(aes(color = gpa_color)) +
  labs(
    x = "\nEmails Sent to Student",
    y = "GPA at End of Semester",
    caption = "r(111), .18, p = .049"
  ) +
  scale_color_identity()

Total Emails Replied to by Student and End of Semester GPA

  hux_corr() |> 
  set_caption("Table 10: A pearson correlation shows a significant positive relationship between emails replied to and GPA at the end of the semester") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)

  geom_hline(yintercept = 0,
             linetype = 2, 
             color = "darkred") +
  geom_point(aes(color = gpa_color)) +
  labs(
    x = "\nEmails Replied to by Student",
    y = "GPA at End of Semester",
    caption = "r(111), .19, p = .036"
  ) +
  scale_color_identity()

Filtering Data
Plots with Filtering
see if Marla Likes the Filtered Plot

Codefsh_sum |> 
  rename(
    `Academic Standing` = academic_standing_december_2022
  ) |> 
  ggplot(aes(total_em_sent, gpa_fall_2022, color = `Academic Standing`)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0,
             linetype = 2, 
             color = "darkred") +
  geom_jitter() +
  labs(
    x = "\nEmails Sent to Student",
    y = "GPA at End of Semester\n",
    caption = "r(111), .18, p = .049"
  ) +
  theme(
    legend.position = "bottom"
  )

Warning: Removed 6 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).









Codefsh_sum |> 
  rename(
    `Academic Standing` = academic_standing_december_2022
  ) |> 
  ggplot(aes(total_em_reply, gpa_fall_2022, color = `Academic Standing`)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0,
             linetype = 2, 
             color = "darkred") +
  geom_jitter(aes(shape = `Academic Standing`)) +
  labs(
    x = "\nEmails Replied to by Student",
    y = "GPA at End of Semester\n",
    caption = "r(111), .19, p = .036",
    legend = "hhh"
  ) +
  theme(
    legend.position = "bottom"
  )

Warning: Removed 6 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).








Is there a difference between End of Semester GPA comparing Academic Warning and Freshman?

Codet.test(fsh_sum$gpa_fall_2022,aw_sum$gpa_sem) |> 
  broom::tidy() |> 
  rename(
    `M_Diff` = estimate,
    `Freshman (M)` = estimate1,
    `Academic Warning (M)` = estimate2,
    t = statistic,
    p = p.value, 
    df = parameter,
  ) |> 
  mutate(
        `CI[LL,UU]` = paste0("[",conf.low |> round(2),
                             ",",conf.high |> round(2),
                             "]")
      ) |>
  select(-method,-conf.low,-conf.high) |> 
  relocate(p, .after = df) |> 
  relocate(df, .before = t) |> 
  hux() |> 
  theme_article() |> 
  set_caption("Table 11: Independent samples t-test show significant difference between Freshmen students and Academic Warning students in end of semester GPA ") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)


Table 11: Independent samples t-test show significant difference between Freshmen students and Academic Warning students in end of semester GPA


M_Diff
Freshman (M)
Academic Warning (M)
df
t
p
alternative
CI[LL,UU]


1.06
2.33
1.27
239
8.16
1.95e-14
two.sided
[0.8,1.31]





Is there a difference between End of Semester GPA comparing Academic Probation and Freshman?

Codet.test(fsh_sum$gpa_fall_2022,ap_sum$gpa_sem) |> 
  broom::tidy() |> 
  rename(
    `M_Diff` = estimate,
    `Freshman (M)` = estimate1,
    `Academic Probation (M)` = estimate2,
    t = statistic,
    p = p.value, 
    df = parameter,
  ) |> 
  mutate(
        `CI[LL,UU]` = paste0("[",conf.low |> round(2),
                             ",",conf.high |> round(2),
                             "]")
      ) |>
  select(-method,-conf.low,-conf.high) |> 
  relocate(p, .after = df) |> 
  relocate(df, .before = t) |> 
  hux() |> 
  theme_article() |> 
  set_caption("Table 12: Independent samples t-test show significant difference between Freshmen students and Academic Probation students in end of semester GPA ") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)


Table 12: Independent samples t-test show significant difference between Freshmen students and Academic Probation students in end of semester GPA

Is there a difference between End of Semester GPA comparing Academic Warning students and Academic Probation students?

Codet.test(ap_sum$gpa_sem,aw_sum$gpa_sem) |> 
  broom::tidy() |> 
  rename(
    `M_Diff` = estimate,
    `Academic Probation (M)` = estimate1,
    `Academic Warning (M)` = estimate2,
    t = statistic,
    p = p.value, 
    df = parameter,
  ) |> 
  mutate(
        `CI[LL,UU]` = paste0("[",conf.low |> round(2),
                             ",",conf.high |> round(2),
                             "]")
      ) |>
  select(-method,-conf.low,-conf.high) |> 
  relocate(p, .after = df) |> 
  relocate(df, .before = t) |> 
  hux() |> 
  theme_article() |> 
  set_caption("Table 13: Independent samples t-test showing no significant difference between Academic Probation students and Academic Warning students in end of semester GPA ") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom") |> 
  set_width(value = 1)

title: Academic Warning
Academic Warning
text:
Exploratory Analyses: Methodology
Data was collapsed such that each student has a total summary count of:

Emails sent by their advisor
Emails replied to by the student - phone calls made to the student by their advisor
Duration of the phone calls
A variable, gpa_diff was calculated that subtracts the student’s semester end GPA from the GPA they started with. If the values are greater than 0, the student improved. If the value is less than 0, the student did not improve.

In all instance (save for freshman data) the time-frame was between January and May.

title: Academic Warning
text:
Exploratory Analyses: Methodology
Data was collapsed such that each student has a total summary count of:

Emails sent by their advisor
Emails replied to by the student
No phone call data was collected or analyzed for Freshmen data.


Code# Summary Counts for Emails sent and Replied
# Exclude Phone Calls
fsh_sum <- 
  fsh |> 
  mutate_at(vars(gpa_fall_2022),as.numeric) |>
  mutate(
    gpa_color = ifelse(gpa_fall_2022 > 0,"#006F71","#dfc26e"),
    academic_standing_december_2022 = case_when(
        academic_standing_december_2022 == "AW" ~ "Academic Warning",
        academic_standing_december_2022 == "Withdrew" ~ "Withdrew",
        academic_standing_december_2022 == "PR" ~ "Academic Probation",
        academic_standing_december_2022 == "Semster withdrawal" ~ "Semester Withdrawal",
        is.na(academic_standing_december_2022) ~ "Good Standing"
      )
    ) |> 
  # Group by rows
  rowwise() |> 
  # Create Summary Counts for Emails Sent/Received and Phone Calls Made/Duration
  mutate(
    total_em_sent = sum(c_across(c(sep_em_sent, oct_em_sent, nov_em_sent, dec_em_sent)), na.rm = T),
    total_em_reply = sum(c_across(c(sep_em_re,oct_em_re, nov_em_re, dec_em_re)),na.rm = T)
  )

Is there a difference between End of Semester GPA comparing Academic Warning and Freshman?

Codet.test(fsh_sum$gpa_fall_2022,aw_sum$gpa_sem) |> 
  broom::tidy() |> 
  rename(
    `M_Diff` = estimate,
    `Freshman (M)` = estimate1,
    `Academic Warning (M)` = estimate2,
    t = statistic,
    p = p.value, 
    df = parameter,
  ) |> 
  mutate(
        `CI[LL,UU]` = paste0("[",conf.low |> round(2),
                             ",",conf.high |> round(2),
                             "]")
      ) |>
  select(-method,-conf.low,-conf.high) |> 
  relocate(p, .after = df) |> 
  relocate(df, .before = t) |> 
  hux() |> 
  theme_article() |> 
  set_caption("Table 11: Independent samples t-test show significant difference between Freshmen students and Academic Warning students in end of semester GPA ") |> 
  set_caption_pos("bottom")|> 
  set_width(value = 1)

Is there a difference between End of Semester GPA comparing Academic Warning students and Academic Probation students?

Codet.test(ap_sum$gpa_sem,aw_sum$gpa_sem) |> 
  broom::tidy() |> 
  rename(
    `M_Diff` = estimate,
    `Academic Probation (M)` = estimate1,
    `Academic Warning (M)` = estimate2,
    t = statistic,
    p = p.value, 
    df = parameter,
  ) |>
